channel.title: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP
channel.description:
Hi there.
I'm trying to find out if there is any way I can report an infected file download on the server status page.
[url=http://virusscan.jotti.org/en/scanresult/ba7d0728afb9c931f2d829e2b002fb8e65374091]This posting for "Saga"[/url] contains a link to download their client, which is an .exe file that contains viruses, as shown in these [url=http://virusscan.jotti.org/en/scanresult/ba7d0728afb9c931f2d829e2b002fb8e65374091]Jotti[/url] and [url=https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/3e0b7bdc7caf3486311838172f176d77e8a0f915b75c0822da2183349b56322d/analysis/1391978127/]VirusTotal[/url] scans.
I feel that it would be wrong to leave such a thing where any Mopar or other internet user may fall for such a pathetic attempt to infect their systems.
Thank you for any help. - Rye

item.title: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

You’re welcome. Good job catching it by the way.

Read full topic
item.source: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP

item.title: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP
item.dc:creator: @CapnRye CapnRye
item.description:
@CapnRye wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:4, topic:539896”]I certainly did and so did anyone I knew.

Either PM or contact Tom on the IRC. He’s usually floating around, making threads like this isn’t really an issue I’m not sure why Travas has something stuck up his ass. It’s important to get the message to others to show that it’s a virus, it’s not as if the thread serves no purpose but in future try and private message a member of staff.[/quote]

I sent him a PM, and I’m glad to hear that action is likely to be taken. Thank you both for responding!

Read full topic
item.source: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP

item.title: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I don’t have anything stuck up my ass, I stated the best way to handle this kind of situation.

Read full topic
item.source: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP

item.title: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

CapnRye:

Thanks, that makes sense. Do you recommend any particular staff member? I know that in a community like this, most may not really ever take action, or even open the message…

I certainly did and so did anyone I knew.

Either PM or contact Tom on the IRC. He’s usually floating around, making threads like this isn’t really an issue I’m not sure why Travas has something stuck up his ass. It’s important to get the message to others to show that it’s a virus, it’s not as if the thread serves no purpose but in future try and private message a member of staff.

Read full topic

item.title: Reporting an advertisement on the SSP
item.dc:creator: @CapnRye CapnRye
item.description:
@CapnRye wrote:

Hi there.

I’m trying to find out if there is any way I can report an infected file download on the server status page.

This posting for “Saga” contains a link to download their client, which is an .exe file that contains viruses, as shown in these Jotti and VirusTotal scans.

I feel that it would be wrong to leave such a thing where any Mopar or other internet user may fall for such a pathetic attempt to infect their systems.

Thank you for any help.

  • Rye

Read full topic
